alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 7:37PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Arizona, from Cosnino to Winona and north to Doney Park, including the following county, Coconino. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 736 PM MST, the public reported flooding in the advisory area along South Cosnino Road and Wapiti Road due to rain from earlier thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Yellow Jacket Canyon, Youngs Canyon, Little Roden Wash, Little Colorado River, Walnut Creek, San Francisco Wash, Babbitt Wash, Diablo, Canyon and Padre Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Flagstaff, Winona, Angell, Cosnino, Twin Arrows, Doney Park, Walnut Canyon National Monument, Flagstaff Mall, Walnut Canyon Visitors Center and Navajo Reservation. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 201 and 220. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 419 and 422. Route 66 between mile markers 201 and 204. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
